Description: Cast brass finger ring with animal's head.
Curator's comments: This ring was presented to the Museum by the Viceroy of Egypt and was almost certainly shown with other Azande material which was included in the 'Egyptian' section of the Paris Exhibition in 1867. It was probably carried northwards to Khartoum by Arab traders from a station in southern Sudan. (JHudson)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2006/7, Kenya, Nairobi Gallery, Hazina: Traditions, Trade and Transitions in Eastern Africa
Acquisition name: Donated by: Isma'il Pasha, Viceroy of Egypt
Acquisition notes: Af.4386 to 4462 is a large group recorded as "Presented by the Viceroy of Egypt, November 1867". This was Isma'il Pasha, Khedive (viceroy) of Egypt and Sudan from 1863 to 1879. The group was registered alongside other groups which came from the 1867 Paris Exhibition (one of which was given by A W Franks), and all these works were shown in that exhibition. See for further comment Af.4386.
